column1: #Text=The world needs miserable people .
#Text=Without misery , we would have no Alexander , no Mozart , no Tolstoy , no van Gogh .
#Text=Some people truly need to feel down , angry , and miserable in order to do their best work , whether art , literature , love songs , or revolutions .
#Text=The problem is that they too often resort to self-destructive methods , such as alcohol and drugs , to get to their desired state .
#Text=If you thrive on " negative effect " , the following steps will help you be unhappy , but via safer , clinically-proven methods .
#Text=And should you ever need a break from misery , you can try this too : Use Modern Psychology to Live a Happy Life .
#Text=Everything , even misery , is best in moderation .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Accept that you might be one of the people built to be miserable .
#Text=Blame the cortical lottery .
#Text=About half of all humans are born in the negative half of the " affective style " spectrum .

column1: #Text=In a nutshell , some people are just born pessimists .
#Text=Thanks to your genes , you are predisposed to focus on threats , and lack confidence to deal with them .
#Text=You develop coping styles that rely heavily on avoidance and other defense mechanisms .
#Text=You work harder to manage your pain than to fix the problems .
#Text=You tend to think that the world is unjust and uncontrollable , and that things turn out for the worst .
#Text=Knowing this can help you stop trying to fit a square peg in a round hole , so to speak .
#Text=With all the emphasis on happiness , your life might be more functional knowing that you 're miserable by default , and that nothing is unusual or dysfunctional about that .
#Text=Know how to move the needle .
#Text=In order to be functional , it 's good to become familiar with ways to move around on the spectrum of misery and happiness .

#Text=There are three clinically-proven methods to move negative affective predispositions toward the positive end of the spectrum ; either avoid these methods completely or use just enough of them so that your productive misery does n't kill you :
#Text=Meditation ,
#Text=Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ,
#Text=Medication ( mainly selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ) .
#Text=Get on the " hedonic treadmill " .
#Text=Work as hard as you want , accumulate all stuff that you want , and get fabulously famous .
#Text=This will raise your expectations , you will keep wanting more , and be no better off than you were before .
#Text=Buy happiness .
#Text=Those who think that money ca n't buy happiness just do n't know where to shop .
#Text=Buy things that make you happy .
#Text=Preferably , ostentatiously expensive things , like a Gucci Soft Stirrup Crocodile Shoulder Bag , Shipwrecked 1907 Heidsieck
#Text=( if you ca n't afford that , Cristal works too ) , Nike Air Force 1 sneakers or , if you are a revolutionary , the Nike Ajax surface-to-air-missile .
#Text=Unlike spending on unforgettable experiences with family and friends , spending on " stuff " wo n't keep you happy for too long .
#Text=This is the " adaptation principle " at work .

column1: #Text=Immerse yourself in noise .
#Text=Humans never fully adapt to noise , especially if it is variable or intermittent .
#Text=It is guaranteed to increase your stress .
#Text=Move to a busy intersection , if you can .
#Text=Commute long distances .
#Text=People do n't fully adapt to long commutes , particularly if these involve driving in heavy traffic .
#Text=Even after years of commuting , those who deal with heavy traffic arrive at work and home with higher levels of stress hormones .
#Text=Bonus points if you have long traffic-ridden commutes because you bought a big house in an expensive neighborhood far away from work .
#Text=Although people do n't adapt to traffic , they quickly adapt to having more space .
#Text=Have no control .
#Text=A sense of control is one of the most effective ways to increase your sense of engagement , energy , and happiness .
#Text=You may need to assert some control to produce your painting , novel , music , or revolution , but try not to assert more control than is absolutely necessary .
#Text=Shun the " self-esteem " hawkers .

column1: #Text=Misguided attempts by schools , self-help gurus , and the popular press to raise self-esteem in children have fostered narcissism , and other dark sides of high self-esteem .
#Text=The popular obsession with " Beauty " has led to disorders such as anorexia and bulimia .
#Text=But although attractive people are not generally happier than unattractive ones , some improvements in a person 's appearance do lead to lasting increases in happiness .
#Text=So if you do n't think highly of yourself , or of how you look , you 're exactly where you need to be .
#Text=Choose your friends wisely .
#Text=This is the big one .
#Text=The strength and number of your relationships trump all other factors in your pursuit of misery .
#Text=Bad relationships make people miserable , and miserable people attract bad relationships ( misery does , in fact , love company ) .
#Text=People never adapt to personal conflict .

#Text=You can count on that bullying patron , editor , lead vocalist , grim-and-determined comrade , or spouse to constantly add to your misery , even when they are not physically present ( just ruminate on the conflict ) .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never try to be miserable if you 're undergoing depression , or are under a lot of stress .
#Text=While misery in moderation can help you , do n't be miserable for too long .
